title: Live coverage: Commercial space station demo, data center precursor to launch on SpaceX Bandwagon mission
summary: SpaceX will fly 18 payloads to a mid-inclination orbit including an intelligence-gathering satellite for the military of South Korea. Liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is set for 1:09 a.m. EDT (0509 UTC).

title: Latvia signs Artemis Accords
summary:
Latvia has signed the Artemis Accords, which outline norms of behavior for safe space exploration, joining a group of now 60 countries.
The post Latvia signs Artemis Accords appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Thales Alenia Space Clears Key Milestone for In-Orbit Servicing Demo
summary:
A group of companies led by Thales Alenia Space has completed the System Preliminary Design Review for Italy’s In-Orbit Servicing (IOS) demonstration mission, funded through the government’s €191.5-billion National Recovery and Resilience Plan (PNRR). In May 2023, the Italian Space Agency (ASI) awarded a €235-million contract for the development of an in-orbit servicing demonstration mission […]
The post Thales Alenia Space Clears Key Milestone for In-Orbit Servicing Demo appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Semiconductor startup to fly payloads on Falcon 9 boosters
summary:
A startup plans to test technology to produce semiconductors in space on a series of Falcon 9 launches using payloads attached to the rocket’s booster.
The post Semiconductor startup to fly payloads on Falcon 9 boosters appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Shenzhou-21 completes rapid docking with Tiangong space station 3.5 hours after launch
summary:
China’s latest crewed mission arrived at the Tiangong space station Friday, just 3.5 hours after launch from Jiuquan spaceport in the Gobi Desert.
The post Shenzhou-21 completes rapid docking with Tiangong space station 3.5 hours after launch appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: China Launches New Space Station Crew
summary: China launched a new three-person crew to their Tiangong-3 space station today. Shenzhou-21 lifted off at 11:44 am EDT and arrived at the space station about three hours later where […]

title: Kyivstar prepares to expand Starlink Direct to Cell testing across Ukraine
summary:
Ukrainian telco Kyivstar said Oct. 31 it is preparing to test SpaceX’s Starlink Direct to Cell service across most of the country, excluding border areas, active combat zones and territories occupied by Russian forces.
The post Kyivstar prepares to expand Starlink Direct to Cell testing across Ukraine appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: For clues to the future of military space, look in the air
summary:

title: Elon Musk on data centers in orbit: “SpaceX will be doing this”
summary: "We could see another transformation of what’s done in space."
